titleStmt.title: The pilgrims profession. Or a sermon preached at the funerall of Mris Mary Gunter by Mr Thomas Taylor. To which (by his consent) also is added, a short relation of the life and death of the said gentle-woman, as a perpetuall monument of her graces and vertues
titleStmt.author: Taylor, Thomas, 1576-1632.
Gunter, H.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by I.D[awson] for Io: Bartlet, and are to be sold at his shop in cheap-side, at the gilt cup in the Goldsmiths row,

notesStmt.note: "Profitable memoriall of the conversion, life and death of Mris. Mary Gunter, set vp as a monument to be looked vpon, both by Protestants and Papists", by H. Gunter, has caption title.
Some print faded, some leaves tightly bound, and some pages marked.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in cheap-side, at the gilt cup in the Goldsmiths row
